column4: hi, after an update, the screen resolution have changed, to 800 x 600, it's just look pretty much bigger than it was in my laptop.
I don't know how to set it back, plus, it's diffcult to access the system configuration.
it was an updage I've just made, it was neat just before.
erusul, well through the automatic updates.
I have the habit to install everything that comes in.
eurusul, I didn't do anything, but installing the software updates ubuntu regularly gives.
before this last update, I ended up like this.
the problem is everything is so big I can't access the "system" button, to try to change to another resolution.
is there a way to change the screen resolution through the terminal?
erusul I did'nt do the first installation :(
erusul I think it was a kernel upgrade yes.
ouch.... I don't know how to reinstall the drivers erusul.
erusul, would it be a bad idea, if I just try to change the screen resolution?
would you give me an example of "xandr"?
xrandr --> to something less bigger than 800 x 600
there are examples in man xrandr at the bottom
